head.title: Visaless Taiwan Stays Increased to 2 Weeks

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Hospitality, Restaurant and Travel

hedline.hl1: Visaless Taiwan Stays Increased to 2 Weeks

block.p: The length of time travelers from the United States and 11 other countries may stay in Taiwan without visas has increased from 5 days to 14. The other countries affected are Australia, Austria, Belgium, Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Japan, Luxembourg, the Netherlands and New Zealand. Visitors from those countries should have up-to-date passports with at least six months remaining before expiration.

The length of time travelers from the United States and 11 other countries may stay in Taiwan without visas has increased from 5 days to 14. The other countries affected are Australia, Austria, Belgium, Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Japan, Luxembourg, the Netherlands and New Zealand. Visitors from those countries should have up-to-date passports with at least six months remaining before expiration.

Americans who want to stay longer than two weeks must apply for visas either by mail or in person at one of the dozen or so Taipei Economic and Cultural offices in the United States. In New York, the address is 801 Second Avenue, Sixth Floor, New York, N.Y. 10017; telephone (212) 370-6600. Visas should take five working days by mail, or five hours in person. TRAVEL ADVISORY
